intro: Dissopetalum mauritianum, commonly known as the Mauritius starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in coastal and moist habitats, often found in shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
